definition: to get promoted
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
government official/governmental/official/public/organ of the body/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Guan
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)

sentences.english: In reward for the promotion, Tama got a new "office".
sentences.chinese: 阿玉升官後，還得到了一間新的“站長辦公室”。

sentences.english: Tom was on pins and needles waiting for news about the promotion.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆坐立難安地等着升官的消息。

sentences.english: Well， Herb just got a promotion.
What gets you enhanced from one rank gets you killed in the afterward rank.
sentences.chinese: 在低軍銜能讓你升官的行爲會在新軍銜殺死你。

sentences.english: So he had got none of any advancement .
Wow, you've been promoted to department head.
sentences.chinese: 哇，你升官當部門主管啦。

sentences.english: Minority career and wealth with the majority of the disaster, in stark contrast.
sentences.chinese: 少數人升官發財與多數人的災難，形成強烈的對照。

sentences.english: He feels he has no hope of climbing the ladder of success.
sentences.chinese: 他覺得他沒有升官發財的希望。

sentences.english: Have you heard about Penny's likely promotion?
sentences.chinese: 你有沒有聽說佩妮可能要升官了？

sentences.english: Let's fire Allan and promote Ann.
sentences.chinese: 咱們讓艾倫走路，給安升官。

sentences.english: B:  If we pull this off, we'll all get promotions.
sentences.chinese: 若我們闖過這一關，我們就升官了。

definition: promote/promotion
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
promotion to the nobility (idiom)
to get promoted (at work etc)/promotion
to confer a title an official position
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
official post
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to join the nobility/to rise through the nobility
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
promotion/to take additional post
to get a promotion
to take an official post/to become a government employee
to render meritorious service/to make worthy contributions/to distinguish oneself
